cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 165 miles SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move north-northwest toward the South Carolina coast through Saturday night, make landfall near the SC/NC border Sunday, then recurve northeastward along/off the Mid-Atlantic coast and pass south-east of New England Tuesday before accelerating into the North Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina / North Carolina border (around Myrtle Beach, SC)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to south of South Santee River SC (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Cape Lookout NC (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coasts of South Carolina and North Carolina this weekend; Mid-Atlantic and New England coasts early next week as the system moves northeastward offshore
weather_observation.wind: Only a very low (≤5%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds reaching the Boston area late Tuesday into early Wednesday; strongest winds expected to remain offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along Boston Harbor as the storm center remains well offshore.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to locally moderate rain bands possible Tuesday–Wednesday as Ana’s remnants pass southeast of New England.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents likely along Massachusetts Bay and adjacent coastal waters early next week, possibly disrupting pilot transfers and small-craft operations.
